title: FIRST ALERT FORECAST - Ho-Ho-Hot days heading into Christmas
text:
FIRST ALERT FORECAST - Ho-Ho-Hot days heading into Christmas
TUCSON, Ariz. (13 News) - Sunny and mild today. Temperatures in the upper 70s to low 80s today, with a chance of breaking the previous record high of 82 in 2024. Record breaking temperatures are possible heading into Wednesday. Monday looks to be the warmest day of the week and has the greater chance of breaking the previously set record. Increasing clouds heading into Tuesday ahead of a system. Shower chances overnight Tuesday into Wednesday, 10% chance, with more shower chances, 30% chance, Christmas Day. Cooler temperatures come with this system, but still warmer than average.
Tucsonâ€™s 7-Day Forecast:
TODAY - Sunny, with a high near 81. South southeast wind around 6 mph becoming light and variable in the morning.
Tonight - Clear, with a low around 50. Light and variable wind becoming southeast around 6 mph in the evening.
Sunday - Sunny, with a high near 81. East southeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm in the morning.
Sunday Night - Mostly clear, with a low around 49.
Monday - Sunny, with a high near 84.
Monday Night - Partly cloudy, with a low around 52.
Tuesday - Partly sunny, with a high near 80.
Tuesday Night - Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55.
Wednesday - A 10 percent chance of showers. Partly cloudy, with a high near 77.
Wednesday Night - A 20 percent chance of showers. Partly cloudy, with a low around 55.
Christmas Day - A 30 percent chance of showers. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 76.
Christmas Night - A 20 percent chance of showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low near 51.
Friday - A 20 percent chance of showers. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 75.
